title: Easy Pizza Sauce Recipe
description: An easy pizza sauce that doesn't require cooking so it's quick to make and tastes fresh and delicious. Mix tomato sauce with seasoning and it's ready.

Sauce 4.5 (1,107) 829 Reviews 93 Photos A simple and easy pizza sauce. No cooking and quick to make. Submitted by Brent Updated on March 3, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 93 93 93 93 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 24 Yield: 2 3/4 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste 1 tablespoon ground oregano 1 ½ teaspoons dried minced garlic 1 teaspoon ground paprika Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix together tomato sauce and tomato paste in a medium bowl until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in oregano, garlic, and paprika to pizza sauce mixture. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Allrecipes / Abbey Littlejohn I Made It Print 1,483 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 11 Calories 0g Fat 3g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 24 Calories 11 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 0% Sodium 148mg 6% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 2g Protein 1g 1% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 8mg 1% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 138mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Pizza Sauce 01 of 93 Photo by  Allrecipes / Abbey Littlejohn 02 of 93 Photo by  Will 07/14/2024 This recipe is PERFECT just the way it is! I just used it to make a 9 inch Chicago deep dish pizza. Five Stars Brent!! 03 of 93 Photo by  Lilbit 01/15/2024 This is a great start but I needed more flavor for making pizza sauce, so I combined other ingredients from another recipe I came across. Very easy to make though! I only took a pic of the pizza itself that I made, not the actual sauce. 04 of 93 Photo by  Kim Nedz 12/18/2022 This was a really good pizza sauce. I live in Pittsburgh, PA, and we have an Italian store called Delallo's. This sauce is as good or better than Delallo's. Thanks for the recipe. I made my crust following https://sugarspunrun.com/the-best-pizza-dough-recipe/ Amazing pizza. 05 of 93 Photo by  y5t7rg26sc 02/15/2022 It’s pretty easy but instead of dried minced garlic I used garlic powder. Still came out great. 06 of 93 Photo by  Shawntae Davis 01/30/2022 Had to tweak so much it wasn't even near the original recipe. Quite confused on why this is rated so high. I added crushed red pepper, Basil, salt, pepper, onion Powder, farlic powder, and switched out fresh garlic 07 of 93 Photo by  Gramina 01/10/2021 08 of 93 Photo by  WKND Chef Jeff 05/03/2020 Our family really liked this when my wife and I made it; a definite improvement over the usual store-bought sauces. However, because I was making enough dough for two 10 x 15 sheet pizzas, have a wife that loves margherita pizza and needed to make enough to cover both, I added a partially-drained 15 oz can of petite diced tomatoes and increased the seasoning. Ultimately, I used approximately 4 teaspoons of oregano and 2-1/2 teaspoons of dried minced garlic, then added approximately 1-1/2 teaspoons of basil and 1-1/2 teaspoons of Italian seasoning along with the original teaspoon of paprika. I warmed the mixture in a sauce pan, while waiting for the pizza dough, to help develop and test the flavor. Everyone enjoyed the flavorful, chunky sauce. I'm including a photo of the final results, specifically my daughters vegan style pizza, made with the sauce and pizza toppings that include a pepper & onion medley, plant-based meatballs / crumbles, non-dairy cheese and pineapple. 09 of 93 Photo by  ajgrim 04/18/2020 10 of 93 Photo by  SPARKLER8666 04/15/2020 A wonderful combination, makes a rich and thick sauce we all love. I use fresh garlic not dried and more like 2 heaping teaspoons (but we love garlic) and also add a good heaping tablespoon and a 1/2 of dried basil. (Update: watch the amount of paprika you use, I had discovered Penzy's half sharp paprika and decided to use it in the recipe... Even though I decreased the amount by 1/3 knowing it was strong, it overwhelmed the sauce. I remember that happened another time with a fresher more flavor forward paprika I had tried. So beware of the amount of paprika.) 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Easy Homemade Pizza Sauce 566 Ratings Essanaye's Pizza Sauce 45 Ratings Grandma Rosie's Extra Smooth Spaghetti Sauce 4 Ratings Delicious Pizza Sauce Recipe 35 Ratings Easy Pizza Sauce from Tomato Sauce 214 Ratings Homemade Pizza Sauce Made Lighter 4 Ratings Exquisite Pizza Sauce 2,940 Ratings Pizza Sauce I 97 Ratings Pasta/Pizza Sauce 131 Ratings Homemade Pizza Sauce from Scratch 54 Ratings Homemade Pizza Sauce with Olive Oil 14 Ratings How to Make Homemade Pizza Sauce 153 Ratings Pizza Sauce with Fresh Tomatoes 13 Ratings Ultimate Pizza Sauce 3 Ratings Fantastic Homemade Pizza Sauce 1 Rating Sicilian Pizza Sauce 11 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Brent
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Mix together tomato sauce and tomato paste in a medium bowl until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir in oregano, garlic, and paprika to pizza sauce mixture. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Enjoy! Allrecipes / Abbey Littlejohn
